Reviews.Title: The Best 2011 TV in the market
Reviews.Author: iEmpower "i really do Empower!!"
Reviews.Content: I have been researching TVs for past few months and thank God I waited for this one. The Samsung UN46D6300 46-Inch LED TV is the latest in this series. This is the highest-end of its 2D LED Line. After this 3D series starts.The Smart Hub with full Web Browser with Flash support made me buy this TV over others. It has been just five days since it came and I started using this TV. Everyday learning something new.So far I have used Smart Hub for Netflix (with HD streaming), YouTube and mostly streaming Flash videos from different sites using the Web Browser.It take a bit practice with the supplied remote to navigate thru sites and to enter URLs or search on Google page. But when I connected my HTC EVO 4G with this TV using Samsung App, Samsung Remote, things became very easy to enter because it (the App) supports full QWERTY key board in real time. BTW Samsung is coming out with a new product QWERTY Keyboard and Remote combination for those who are interested. I believe it will be priced about $100.00. I don't know weather I will buy that after having the App on my EVO.The Samsung App Store have a huge collection of Apps. The biggest help is Samsung support videos that makes life very easy without the guess work.Great picture quality in LED. Nice sound, I have not plugged it in external speaker system. Decent size for my living room (55-inch seemed a bit bigger for me).You do not get Smart Hub and Web Browsing in 2010 Models. Also all models below 6300 series in 2011 do not have Web Browsers.  I highly recommend this TV (D6300 Series) over 2010 models (C6300 Series).

Reviews.Title: Overall Great TV (Video Gamer Review Included)!
Reviews.Author: ExtroFlashG
Reviews.Content: Pros:Picture is amazingMultiple HDMI inputsEasy to setupSmart TV is exceptionalCons:Remote isn't optimized for Internet use(They have a keypad-remote coming soon)Some apps missing from TVI read a boat load of reviews on a bunch of TVs and went to BestBuy on numerous occasions to figure out the perfect TV for me. I picked this TV over the D6000 because I wanted the web browser. Overall, the TV is amazing. Picture quality is excellent, I'm very impressed with the "auto motion plus" feature that adds frames for fast scenes. I'm a big time sports fanatic and gamer so I was really interested in this feature. You can also adjust how hard you want it to work, which is awesome. The sound quality is good, I didn't expect to be blown out of the water since all TV companies expect you to connect their TV to a home theater. You also don't need to put in special codes to adjust the RGB, it's all there in the menu for video-enthusiasts.It has a blu-ray mode that optimizes blu-rays to look their best. I saw "Dark Knight" in a whole new light this past week! It has a game mode that turns off all the extra processing to minimize input lag. The Smart TV function is great. It continues video in the top left corner and you can browse your apps like Netflix, Hulu Plus, Facebook, YouTube and all that awesomeness. The 6300 comes with the web browser which works well. It also allows you to watch TV and browse at the same time.The only problem I have with the TV is the remote. You can definitely tell they made the remote to frustrate you and get you to buy the new keypad. Luckily, there is an app for that on androids and iphones. Also, I'm a fitness enthusiast so I was excited that GymBox and Exercise TV came for free with the TV, however, they aren't there or available for download. My guess is that they still are rolling out all the apps since it's so new.FOR GAMERS:Game mode cuts lag down but sacrifices picture quality to do so. The game still looks good but it'll make you sad when you compare it to game mode being off. I tested out Uncharted 2, Crysis 2, Gears 3 beta, and some sports titles. With all video processing turned on, there is a definite lag, HOWEVER,  I have found out with game mode off, you can cut off LED Motion Plus and set Auto Motion Plus to custom and have it at a 1-3 depending on preference, it will still look amazing and minimize lag. I've gone online and my K/D has not suffered at all(Uncharted-1.5, Crysis-1.5-but this past week with the TV it's at around 2-3 K/D with the improved picture quality). I tested out Mortal Kombat with everything still on and it played great, I didn't go online, though.If you have a question about anything because I'm sure I forgot some cool things about the TV, leave a comment.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with mediocre browser
Reviews.Author: Anx
Reviews.Content: This TV is exactly sames as the D6000 plus a web browser (I don't care much about missing a few contrast ratio). That's the sole reason of me buying this unit.The TV is GREAT and produces STUNNING picture quality! I was so happy to buy this sammy and never regret it. I guess lot of people have posted about the feature and quality of TV so I would keep it to the point.I am bit tech savvy and would like to be specific about observations. I was thinking to avoid buying Google TV (~$300) by purchasing this browser enabled TV. You need to understand that this is not a computer/smartphone however the browser loads websites very quickly even faster than some of the smartphones out there and does support flash videos however I had few issues: 1. It crashed loading some websites like HULU.com . this site loads lots of tiny flash videos ready to get played and I guess TV sometimes couldn't handle that. 2. As another reviewer mentioned it lacked sound sometimes while refreshing the page or even at beginning. I experienced it with sony's [...] and MTV. 3. I also noticed that videos were choppy on heavy websites including both Crackle and Hulu. I understand it could be due to internet connection however I am at 10Mbps and I did verify my net speed at the time of this issue.  I own a PS3 and I think the browser in a PS3 is way better than this TV. Its a pain to launch keyboard while a site is loading and TV is very sluggish, even the iPhone app remote wouldn't help much that time. Other times iPhone/Android remote app is the best for typing. Nonetheless, most of the other popular stuff like twitter, facebook, Youtube, google talk, daily motion, fandango, ESPN etc are already downloadable as an APP for this TV hence I really got to used the browser very minimally.  Other issues I found with this TV was clouding effect where all 4 edges as well as center part of screen are bit whitish and you could EASILY notice that in an average dark scene. Again I am very specific to observe and hence it may not be much of an issue for some people.  I use external speakers with this TV and there are good no of options for you to connect external speakers:  1. Audio out jack (this is what I use with my old Altec lansing speakers)  2. Optical Audio output  3. ARC (Audio return channel)  Because of these drawbacks I actually purchased the D6400 which was on a promotion and is 3D enabled. I am very happy with that TV and picture quality seems to surpass what D6300 offers in terms of smoothness and clarity. Again this is my observation and it could be different with you.  To sum it up my recommendation would be to either buy D6000 or D6400 depending upon the deal you are getting.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Image, Poor Reliability
Reviews.Author: A. Mason
Reviews.Content: I gave the Samsung UN40D6300 5-stars for clarity. The picture quality is simply the best I have ever seen without question. True, the motion control and extreme "live look" won't appeal to everyone. I welcomed the giant leap in picture quality. I'm willing to accept that the murky dark ages of imagery is about to give way to true realism.For the first two weeks of owning this Smart TV: I was astonished and delighted to near hysterics. My girlfriend wanted to be at my house every night just to gaze into it. We felt like we were experiencing something like what people did watching color TV for the first time. It came with all (but one) of the adapters I needed to set up as I had with my old LCD and I was happy. Extremely happy.Strike One: I decided to purchase the LAN adapter, the several extra ones I have didn't fit or didn't work. I was excited to browse the web and play apps on a TV. It came, got online with minimal effort, and discovered the online experience is a throwback from the days of dial up. Crippling slow, and YouTube seems limited to paid advertisements. I felt like I wasted my money on making my Smart TV smart. So did my girlfriend, who was more anxious to use it than I was.Strike Two: After a few weeks, the audio volume started dropping. At first I thought this was based on the individual programs, but soon, every program needed to be cranked to about 50 of 100 to be heard. This was annoying considering that my first impression of the audio on this LED was "way above average" set at about 25 of 50. I loved the picture so much, I was willing to overlook this flaw, which I shouldn't have.Strike Three: On the 28th day of owning this marvel of technology, I watched a few standard definition programs in a row. I switched back to HD programing and an alternating bar pattern was left behind on the entire left half of the screen. I updated the software. I conducted the built in picture test. It affected all sources including the Xbox 360. The light/dark bar pattern gradually faded except in the upper left corner of the screen.I returned it for a Samsung LCD 120hz and so far, 95% happy.I will check on the technology in another two years. If Samsung can add durability and product lifespan to astonishing picture quality, plus a robust high-speed internet experience, they will have a product of unmatched value.

Reviews.Title: Don't put too loud!!!  And buy a separate keyboard for internet
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: The company Amazon was purchasing this item from (Video & Audio Center) was very slow to ship this item.  It was going to ship in 11 business days instead of 3-5 so I cancelled the order and picked it up at Best Buy.  They were great about issuing me a credit though.  So, here are our comments about this TV:Don't get me wrong, we absolutely LOVE this TV.  However, it takes some work to get this TV right.  Here are some of the issues we've encountered and have rectified:The sound quality is horrific.  The speakers are terrible since this TV is so thin, and you absolutely need surround sound in order to hear everything properly.  We've read that this is the case for most new TV's and not just this one.  Constantly having the surround sound on is a problem with apartment living, so just be AWARE of this before you purchase this TV.  You actually cannot listen to it without surround sound because you will blow the speakers.  We couldn't put our sound past the number 14 without hearing static coming from the speakers.  We were also having some blur issues at the time so we exchanged it.  Best Buy gave us a BIG problem with this and had the geek squad hook up the TV in the store before the exchange.  They said the sound quality was fine and speakers were not blown.  We refused to keep the TV and they finally issued the exchange.The picture quality is AMAZING once you figure out the settings!  It took my fiancee about a week to play with the settings and even then he couldn't get rid of the blur issues he had when playing his PS3.  When we exchanged the TV, the geek squad gave us some helpful hints on optimizing the quality of viewing and which settings to use.  This is what they recommended: Under menu, picture, choose "movie" mode.  Also under menu, picture, picture options, auto motion plus, choose "smooth".  That helped a lot, but we tweaked the settings even further.  We changed auto motion plus to clear, and took only a few picture quality settings from the "dynamic" setting such as color, brightness, etc and used it under the "movie" mode because we felt dynamic gave you best color & picture, and movie mode the best quality with the blur issues.  So...be patient, but once you get the setting right you will be amazed!!!As for the smart TV part of this TV...you need to purchase a separate keyboard & box that communicates with the keyboard.  Using the smart TV through the standard TV controller will make you pull your hair out!!!  I still have to hook up the keyboard because the first time I tried there was a communication issue with our wireless router.  Once it's hooked up, I will definitely use the internet more.  It's pretty cool to watch my favorite youtube video's on this gigantic TV!!!  The internet gets a bit tripped up once in a while, but so far I've solved this issue by taking out the USB wifi cable and moving it to another USB port on the TV.  Seems to be much faster now

Reviews.Title: What I expected from Samsung...
Reviews.Author: John A.
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific TV with outstanding image quality, a sleek appearance, good feature set, and is very easy to use. I was a very loyal Sony TV customer until I bought my first Samsung 6 years ago - and that was a 56" DLP projection screen 1080P unit that I have never regretted buying.I have this unit installed outdoors under a covered patio; my only real complaint with the unit is the glossy screen and associated glare, which I believe is just the case with any LED television.I also purchased the UN40D6000 unit for our upstairs family room unit, and am very happy with that unit as well - in fact probably moreso. I love the Samsung TV apps on both, but bought the 6300 on the 46" for outside because of the full Internet browser capability. It is okay, but is Virtually useless if all you have is the included remote. I have an iPad with the Samsung TV remote app, which works nicely as it has a virtual keyboard feature. You could also purchase the QWERTY remote (is it available yet?) but then you are getting into spending some considerable additional $$ for the Internet browser TV feature, and it's not THAT important to me.I have an iPad with the Samsung network remote app installed (so I have access to a virtual keyboard that way) and that is okay. (I really do like having the Samsung TV remote app for the iPad for other reasons, too)Bottom line, this is a fantastic TV at a very good price... Outstanding picture quality, sleek appearance, and very cool Samsung TV Internet apps. If I had it to do over, though - I would save the $$ and buy the UN40D6000. The full Internet browser is not worth the $ for me.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV!
Reviews.Author: P. Malone
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research on televisions before purchasing the D6300.  Then, spent a lot of time at Best Buy comparing picture quality, which is pretty useless by the way, as Best Buy hooked all of their TV's up via coax cable, and the pictures aren't as sharp as they could be.Setting up the unit was amazingly easy, without a single problem or glitch. I wall mounted the unit, using a low profile mounting bracket, and with the 1.2" thickness of the TV, it only protrudes about two inches from the wall.  And, playing blu-ray vids shows you how phenomenal the picture is.I read the rest of the reviews here, and some of the negative comments baffle me.  The viewing angle on the TV is great!  I can watch the TV at almost 90 degrees off center with no loss of quality.  And, when connecting the TV to a newer amp, you can control the amp as well as the TV with the remote.One of the best features of this TV is the two way audio, (only available on HDMI 2).  When you are accessing the built in apps on the TV, the sound is automatically routed back through the HDMI cable to the amp and you don't have to use the TV speakers.Overall, I have zero complaints about the TV and am completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Brij
Reviews.Content: The only difference between UN40D6300 and UN40D6000 is the built in web browser.There are many web sites which i can watch and stream movies. I bought considering that aspect. Picture quality is great and clarity is sharp. Better than Sony TV's.  The SMARTApp's are cool way to get connected. Its really a Smart TV

Reviews.Title: Awesome!! Feels like you are there instead of watching TV
Reviews.Author: Neverskunked
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome.. The picture is great the Web Browsing is very cool.. Although you do need to buy the (qwerty keyboard) the regular remote doesn't cut it.  Amazon was great, delivery on time and great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: Good Hardware but Poor Software & Support
Reviews.Author: adventure "adventure62"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this TV with high hopes. TV is excellent if you want to watch DVD or regular cable TV programs. Samsung advt. this product as top of the line Internet TV with browser. Browser does not work with any program of video clip that requires adobe flash player. TV comes with unknown version of Internet Explorer. I have talked to Samsung about upgrading the browser. Answer is tough luck.I bought a keyboard after paying $100 so that I can browse the net and watch videos from Youtube etc. It is a real pain to do that. However, I could watch Netflix and Hulu without any problem. I wanted to see Movies from Amazon but no luck. Remote has Yahoo Hot Apps button but it does not work.Samsung website is very lousy and not designed for users. People are asking questions for months and there is no answer. No customer support or useful FAQ. Live chat support is useless as these people have no idea about Samsung product. I am a tech heavy person but this TV has given me sweat. If you just want a LED TV, don't waste your extra money on getting this Internet mumbo jumbo. This product is not fully tested and just qualifies as beta product for Internet video streaming. Samsung has lot of TV apps but downloading them is .... I even created an account and paid samsung money for apps but getting a free app is ... Most of the Samsung website pages gives the error. Samsung TV also gives errors that gives no clue. Stay away from Samsung Internet TV or wait till this product is fixed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with some restrictions
Reviews.Author: Nouman
Reviews.Content: I have been using this TV for about a week now. The TV worked great right out the box, easy to set up, great picture quality, web browser is sweet! However, I found the following things which compelled me not to give it 5 stars-Remote - It comes with a web browser but no QWERTY keyboard. It can be very frustrating browsing internet with a virtual keyboard. I got around this issue by using Samsung Remote App for my iPhone but would have liked to see the QWERTY keyboard included with my $1200+ TV.-Speakers - Built-in speakers are pretty bad but I guess that is any LED TV. I can imagine how difficult it must be to fit a nice set of speakers in a 1" thick TV. I went out and bought a soundbar for additional 100 bucks. It sounds great now!-Samsung Apps- Missing a couple f Apps that I would have liked. For example, app for Willow TV is advertised on Samsung's website and this TV is listed as compatible. However, it is missing for this device and I can't download it. Samsung Apps are very inconsistent across devices. Can't do much about this...Overall, I am happy with my purchase. I was in the market for a TV that can deliver crisp picture and has all the latest and the greatest features. This TV met my expectations!

Reviews.Title: Good Picture - Web Browser Doesn't Work
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture like all Samsung TV's.  The only reason to buy this TV over other Samsung models is because it comes with a web browser.  I couldn't get the web browser to fire up.  It spins a bit and then the TV reboots.Samsung support is polite but clueless.  First I tried e-mail and they told me to clear my browser cache, delete temporary internet files, or try a different browser.  It took three e-mails for them to realize I was speaking about the browser on the TV - not my PC.  They asked me to call it in.Calling it in was a waste of time.  She kept giving me instructions for Internet @ TV (old version of apps) instead of SmartHub.  In the end she told me to upgrade to the latest version of SmartHub and to download it from the web.  I explained that I had already upgraded the firmware but she said I needed to upgrade SmartHub.So off I go and of course there is no upgrade on the web for SmartHub - it's part of the firmware.  Yet another call back and this time they want to send someone out.  She couldn't really explain how sending someone out was going to fix it.I'll be returning this to Amazon and buying the cheaper model without the web browser.  No point in paying for features that don't work.Update: I'm on my second one - returned the first one to Amazon.  The web browser does work on this one (although I did not update the firmware just in case).  The web browser is mediocre but at least it works.  Upgraded to 3 stars - would have given 4 if the first one worked out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: Philippe Spiteri
Reviews.Content: This is my first HD TV. Spent a lot of time comparing Sony, LG, and Samsung. Finally went with the Samsung UN40D6300. Beautiful picture. TV is now wired into my home network. No problem streaming videos from my file server or from internet. Very satisfied with TV so far.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy Overall
Reviews.Author: Out Loud FLL
Reviews.Content: We've had the tv for about 2 months now and overall we are very happy.  I'll break my review into sections:Paul's TV - 5 Stars - We ordered from Paul's TV fulfilled through Amazon so 2-day shipping was free with Prime Membership.  Ordered it on a Sunday and had it on Tuesday or Wednesday. Very happy!  :)Ease of Assembly - 5 Stars - Two of us had it together in just a few minutes. Just an aside, I love the swivel stand.  Turns just enough to get rid of any glare that comes in from the two windows in the room.Picture Quality - 5 Stars - No cable here, and even with just an antennae, it looks great.  I didn't like the picture settings so I went to CNET's forums and used a combination of some recommended settings.  Got rid of the soap opera effect and love the picture.Samsung TV Apps - 3.5 Stars - For me, Netflix is the most important app and it works quite well.  I've noticed that it works better when I run a cable into the LAN port instead of using the wireless.  It's close enough to my router so that's no big deal.  I've also used Pandora, Hulu Plus, You Tube, etc. and they work well.  My biggest concern is that Samsung has their own app store and that probably means it won't get as much attention as it would if they partnered with Google. Time will tell.Built In Web Browser - 2.5 stars - We knew this wasn't going to compare to a browser on a computer and we were right.  It's functional but a bit inconsistent with response time to load pages and videos.  We have some newspaper sites saved as favorites and it works fine to do basic surfing.  We also bought the qwerty remote for an extra $100 and that's nice to have.That's about all for now.  Love to hear comments or questions.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT VALUE FOR THE PRICE!
Reviews.Author: Joan M. Iacono "Happily Retired & Reading all...
Reviews.Content: We were searching all over for a new LED TV.  We came upon a Samsung 55" TV at Best Buy, but it was NOT the newest model, and it cost much more than what I finally paid.  We did like the picture and sound quality (ours sounds fine to me - no tinny resonance or anything of that sort that I've seen other people complain about in other reviews) and decided to look for a Samsung on line.  Of course, the best price was from Amazon.Com.  I placed the order, and the TV was delivered three days later.  The set came intact, no bumps or scratches etc, and after we waited the 4 hour period (as per the instruction book) we turned the set on and it was perfect.  Saved a lot of money, got a great product; thanks Amazon.Com!

Reviews.Title: TV is very cool. Weird experience getting it
Reviews.Author: IronMnCO
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd write a review since I spent so much time trying to gauge others opinions about the product, before purchasing. The offer I found on Amazon offered the TV and wireless lan adapter for "free".  Turns out they charged me for the adapter and reduced the price by the same amount from the TV...weirdness #1. So, I'm waiting for my TV and must have been in the shower and missed them, so guess what UPS does...They drop my $1000 TV off with my non-english speaking neighbors who I rarely see or speak to and have them sign for it! Talk about awkward... weirdness #2.  I also did not get any text notifications that I signed up for until 30 minutes after it was delivered.Ok, enough about that...Lets talk about the TV.  Out of the box it looks beautiful, elegant and stylish. This TV is made to be wall mounted, the stand doesn't do it justice. Initial setup was fairly easy. The back of the TV is totally HDMI oriented so, if you have composite or A/V cables there are 2 adapters that come with the TV that have to be used. no big deal, but different. I plugged in the wireless adapter during the setup and was connected in minutes.Picture quality for cable HD channels and Blue-Ray movie was amazing. Colors were rich and crisp detail gave it a nearly 3d feel during parts of the Blue-Ray movie.  I haven't done much gaming or watched any sports yet so jury is still out on the blur effect but out of the box settings seemed adequate. The sound works and gets loud if you turn it up...not much more you can ask for with this type of TV and I use external speakers anyway. (btw..there is a movie setting for the speakers that adds some depth to the sound if you are going to use them)I was very excited about the Smart interface when I first opened it. The initial interface is nice with big icons and fairly easy navigation. The apps store was interesting and very much like what you see on your smart phone with a nice variety of apps...pretty slick I must say.The absolute worst thing about this TV is the browser. I am an I/T guy and this totally awful to try to navigate. My guess is they did this on purpose to get people to buy the keyboard. I won't go into detail, but my only option to make this usable was to take 10 mins...yes 10 mins to enter my top 5 websites and save them under favorites so I don't have to type if I ever decided to use the browser. Browser aside the rest of the internet experience with the TV was very good. I was even able to setup Samsung Allshare on my pc (Had to call customer support to locate the software) and was able to stream movies and photos to the TV directly from my pc. Very cool feature once you step through it a couple of times.All in all this TV was exactly what I expected.  Stylish with a small footprint,brilliant picture quality,and steaming options that will allow me cut down on my cable bill.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: EB 99
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing this TV and when the price came down to under $1000 at Amazon, I jumped on it.  Went with the free shipping and got it within a week.  It even came with the Samsung Wireless adapter - a $50 value.  (I haven't been able to hook up the Wi-Fi yet.  I will update this post when i can)  The picture is great on all channels.  Even makes regular analog broadcasts look better.  The HD channels are amazing.  Make sure you have a cable box with an HDMI output so that you can run an HDMI cable from the box to the TV.  I especially love watching sports on this TV.  I haven't noticed any blurring with the fast action like i noticed on my friend's plasma TV.  I would say that the sound isn't that great, but that seems to be a design problem with a lot of these HDTVs - the speakers are in the back and that doesn't make for great sound projection.  Its ok for watching regular TV shows but if you want to watch a movie, you should definitely hook this TV up to some kind of external speaker system like a front sound bar or surround sound system.  I have an older HTIB and I ran cables from the TV through that system and it sounds great.  By the way, I wasn't sure which cable to use to hook up this TV to my HTIB and I went to my favorite cable site - Monoprice.com - and emailed them with the make and model of my TV and told them what i wanted to do and they emailed me back within a day with a recommendation for the exact cables I needed (which were under $5!).  I would have given this TV 5 stars except i took away one star for the difficulty of the menu system which is ok but which buries some functions in several layers of the main menu and also having some problems hooking up the wi-fi.  Other than that, i would highly recommend this TV.update - Just wanted to clarify that while i did purchase this TV through Amazon, the actual seller was Paul's TV.  So credit goes to Paul's TV for the free shipping and throwing the wi-fi adapter at no extra cost!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Tom Scott
Reviews.Content: This was our first TV.  Received the first one we ordered in 2 days but it had a crack in the screen and the delivery folks took it right back to the truck after opening it.  Amazon of course was great and shipped the 2nd one quickly.  No issues.  Remote was very delayed but Samsung tech. support was great in helping reprogram it.  Installed easily on our wall mount.  It's been fun.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied with purchase so far
Reviews.Author: George L.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a TV with a good reputation for quality and dependability as well as the features of a SMART TV. So far so good. Without being redundant of many of the reviews previous to mine, after using this for about a month, I believe I made an excellent choice. The picture is excellent with many adjustments available to fine tune if you find it necessary. The default 'Auto Motion Plus' feature is a bit much and have changed it to the 'clear' option. The sound is quite good but I rely on an external sound system to enhance the experience. The remote is very responsive, something I noticed immediately compared to the TV this replaced (Older HD Vizio) but does leave a bit to be desired when using with the browser function. I would say also that the browser, although useful, remains the TV's weakest link. I had a lot of difficulty viewing videos from some websites using the browser. It worked intermittently and not dependably. I can only hope software upgrades in the future improve this. I don't see why it couldn't.The apps available are plentiful but again hope and expect the number available to greatly increase in the future. I can think of many potential sites like ESPN3 where an app would be an obvious popular add on. I have long ago done away with cable and it's bill and rely on OTA local network stations in glorious HD (and free). Along with the available apps like Netflix, Hulu and VUDU, I have more than enough to watch for minimal cost. A Smart TV makes going without cable a logical choice and a trend in the making.I have made 2 inquires to Samsung about features on the TV via email and their response was within 24hrs each time. That is also important. All that is left is hope that they continue to add new apps when they are available and that the TV lasts longer than my previous TV lasted. So far, it has been a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: good picture, horrendous web experience
Reviews.Author: jfb
Reviews.Content: Imagine the quality of a typical Apple product.  Now, imagine the opposite and you'll have an idea of what this so-called SMART TV is like.  The picture is great, but if you're buying a SMART TV you're paying extra for the web features, which in this case are terrible.  Perhaps if you're only interested in Netflix or Hulu, it's OK, but if you want to browse the web then you should buy something else.First of, it is VERY slow, with choppy videos, as mentioned by several other reviews.  According to one of the tech support folks on their help line, this is because the browser connects to a server in Korea.  I have no idea if he's right, but it seems plausible given the slow speed. Maybe this is also why the pointer is so hard to move around the screen.  It really is painful to use.Second, it doesn't come with the QWERTY keyboard remote, instead you get a more-or-less standard remote and if you want to browse to a web address (or type anything in to a web page) you have to use the multi-tap cell-phone texting method (press '2' three times for the letter 'c' and so on).  AWEFUL!!  The web page says that the QWERTY keyboard remote is compatible with this TV (for an extra $99), but tech support says it's not.  Who knows?!Lastly, the browser is not compatible with Adobe Flash.  This too seems ridiculous, but in my experience it was true and the tech support guy confirmed it.I don't suppose the shipping is free when you return something, I can only imagine how much this is going to cost to send back.Someday this technology will work at the $1000 price range, but today is not that day.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Penitent1
Reviews.Content: Overall this is an outstaning TV.  The picture quality is the best.  The SmartTV apps are solid, but there is a delay in running them.  From the time you push the "Smart" button until it loads varries between 15 and 30 seconds.Everyone who is complaining about the web browser - its a TV people, not a computer.  If you want IE, than hook up your computer to this bad boy.  I have used MLB.tv running as an app on the 6300, and the quality is MUCH better than Roku.  Overall I have been impressed and would not hesitate to buy this tv again.

Reviews.Title: Motion Not Good
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Picture quality on this TV is good, however, motion rate is very very bad.  For some people this is not an issue, however once I pointed out the issue to other people, it becomes very very anoying.  Issue is that with fast moving pictures scene images become distorted.  A lot of people don't even notice it, but one you do, you notice it every time.  Also the component port on this TV didn't work, called Samsung, they sent out 2 techs, couldn't fix it so sent tv back.  Got a replacement and same thing, motion rate was bad and component port didn't work.  Return again and we ended up getting Samsung 3D plasma and 3D DVD player for half the price.  Plasma is great beside the glare issue in bright rooms.  Wouldn't recomend an LCD/LED TV until the processors can keep up with motion.Both Samsung and Vendor were professional to deal with, like the Samsung Brand, just not this particular model.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture with great features and intuitive design
Reviews.Author: Jeff Laufenberg
Reviews.Content: It is 2011, and I am just now replacing our Sony Trinitron 27" console TV (which weighs nearly 80 lbs), with this sleek, lightweight Samsung.  I did a lot of internet research and knew I wanted LED, non-3D, and 40-49" screen size based on the wall unit in the room where we placed this TV.  I like Samsung products and am very, very happy with this purchase thus far.I am connecting this TV to a new Samsung Blu-Ray wifi-enabled DVD player, a Denon receiver (pre-HDMI), and some high-quality bookshelf speakers and subwoofer, so am not utilizing the TV's built-in sound capabilities for the audio, nor am I using its internet browsing capabilities (doing so thru the wifi Blu-Ray player).  However, if you're going to spend $1000+ on a TV, you really need to hook it up to a home theater system to truly enjoy the experience of watching, say, the BBC's Planet Earth series on this big, beautiful screen and hearing the audio thru a high-quality entertainment system anyway.  So I'm not too picky about the TV's built-in speakers, as other reviewers may be.  Also, I assume the browsing/Netflix capabilities I can see via my Samsung Blu-Ray player are reasonably similar to what I'd see using this Samsung TV's browsing capabilities, and all I can say is, it works the way I got used to accessing Netflix using my Nintendo Wii on my old Sony box.  I don't have a very strong opinion one way or the other about Samsung's apps, or the browser interface, etc..  As far as I'm concerned, this TV does far more than any TV I've ever owned before, so it's all gravy!I believe you can get accessories for this TV to make it 3D-capable, but I don't plan to watch my home TV with 3D glasses on or endure the inevitable headaches (literal and figurative) associated with 3D TV.  What I do care about is having a TV that has a great picture, looks attractive in our wall unit, and has features that I can grow into as needed.  This TV fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: M. Harper
Reviews.Content: Love the LED picture quality.  Love the size, easily viewed from a distance. The LED picture gives a crisp quality that is unbeatable side by side to regular LCD or plasma.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture
Reviews.Author: Timber "Timber"
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome TV. I did a lot of research and settled on the Samsung UN55D6300. Easy setup right out of the box. The screen on my three year old LCD TV is warm to the touch. The screen on this LED TV is cool to the touch. That tells me less power is being consumed. Sound is decent, but I hooked up a BOSE Cinemate GS II, which is way better. (It should be.)

Reviews.Title: best vaue
Reviews.Author: Bthebert@dreamsoft.com
Reviews.Content: purchased this model after doing a lot of research. It was delivered on time and the delivery people removed from box and did primary set up ( like attaching base) I wish a samsung link was included or built in , it's not so I had to buy one. stores in my area do not carry newest model link but old works fine.The picture quality has been great some far . I plan to buy a samsung soundbar model d550 because it have HDMI inputs in a month or two has the price drops.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but a few quirks
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a great TV with a great picture and offers a lot of features for the price.  I use this TV for every-day TV, sports (football mostly) and movies.  The picture is bright and contrast is very good.  Viewing angle is not bad, but the colors do tend to wash out a bit after maybe 50-60 degrees off center, especially when displaying a brighter picture.  Football looks great on it and one of the first things I watched a baseball game which was absolutely awesome looking.I did have to spend a little time to adjust some settings for things I found a bit annoying out of the box.  The "Eco Solution" settings would adjust the picture brightness based on room lighting and would dim the picture way too much with the default settings.  The good news is it provides ample adjustment to limit how much it dims as well as the ability to turn it off completely.  I also had to adjust brightness, contrast, etc. to look good in my environment and to suit my tastes, but that is not uncommon.  The other odd behavior I found was when watching shows with the constant (and annoying, IMHO) camera movement like "Law and Order".  The movement of characters in the show looked very unnatural and almost had a weird 3D effect.  I found that adjusting the Auto Motion Plus to the "Clear" setting improved this quite a bit and I don't notice it any more.  Again they provide a few knobs to turn to adjust this to your preference.While I didn't buy a TV for internet apps, they are rather cool.  I use Pandora quite a bit and it's great.  The Social TV would probably be pretty cool for those into social networking since you can watch TV and mess around on Facebook at the same time.  I'm not much into this stuff and I still found it to be a nice feature.  The Smart Hub user interface is a bit clunky but gets the job done.  The internet browser is useless without a way to point-and-click.  Entering text for web sites or logging into online services is painful without some type of keyboard.  I downloaded the Samsung Smart TV remote app for my iPod Touch and that works pretty well, but still is quirky at times.The controls on the front of the TV are absolutely useless.  The controls are on the lower-right front of the TV.  These are not buttons, but are touch sensitive areas in the bezel with no defined borders and the silk-screening is virtually impossible to see with the TV on and without bright lighting in the room.  Keep the remote handy.Overall, I'd give a 4.5+ star rating for picture quality.  I'd give it a 5 if not for the viewing angle.I'd give a 3.5 star rating for everything else...mostly needing improvement in user interface.

Reviews.Title: Not What Represented
Reviews.Author: DenverTechy
Reviews.Content: I have a 46 inch Samsung 8000 that works very well.  Very clear picture and great 3D.  But this UN40D6300 is a failure.  I purchased the 6300 at $100 more than the 6000 because it supposedly had a web browser.  I hooked up the 6300 to my wireless internet and got NetFlix, etc., but when you tried to use the browser the set just reboots and goes back to regular television.  Samsung was absolutly no help.  Their tech/service department had no idea what they were talking about.  After being on the telephone with them (at least three different "techs") for over an hour, I finally talked to someone who at least sounded like she knew what she was talking about.  But all she said was that there was a software problem with the set and they were working on a solution.  So why didn't the previous 3 people know this and how can a reputable merchant sell a TV that doesn't have a feature that they advertise and for which they charge $100 more?  It's been over 30 days and they still don't have the software fix.  Until Samsung gets their act together, I would suggest not purchasing their products.  In these days service and support are number 1, but Samsung doesn't understand that.  I would point out the the set was sold through Vann's, and Vann's has been very good; their people are friendly and understanding -- unlike Samsung, Vann's is first rate.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME HDTV!!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Engler
Reviews.Content: For this price you can't go wrong.Researched for weeks prior to buying and narrowed my choices down to Samsung,then four models,and finally this model.The picture and resolution are just outstanding with absolutely no bleeding of color that I can notice.Blacks are rich and deep but do not make night scenes unwatchable as some higher priced...NOT higher end HDTVs tend to.Fast paced sports are no problem to view at all without even using the mode to prevent motion blur..and I watch a LOT of NASCAR racing!.Sound is just fine for my 14x26 room but will be adding upgraded sound just to enhance the package.Remote is easy to figure out and so far,have not had difficulty finding adjustments.Simple to set up and hang,looks great on the wall...so thin it is like a hung picture!.Have not got into the on-line apps as yet but am very pleased with my purchase and am sold on Samsung quality over other leaders in HDTV. DON'T be fooled by what you see in the store...they will "tweak" tvs to make the ones on sale look better than others!. The reviews I poured over from the experts...not just the owners of tvs,are right on.This is a GREAT buy and you should keep it up front in your mind if you are in the market!!  Andrew  Bristol,N.H.

Reviews.Title: Thin Horizontal Lines
Reviews.Author: Theo
Reviews.Content: The Tv is a great tv, but it came with thin horizontal lines on top left corner of the led panel... I'm very dissapointed at this. I've been doing some research and it seem s that Samsung led's have this problem all the time.

Reviews.Title: do not need web browser
Reviews.Author: skiwindjunkie
Reviews.Content: I do love this TV. I spent more money on it though:( through Sears. I felt better buying a big ticket item where future problems allowed better local services. $1230 plus $80 for the wireless usb connect. It is a great looking tv picture wise. I think the sound is ok and not as bad as other reviews make it. I have owned it for about 4 months and so far no problems. I did buy the keyboard quewry remote on ebay for 39$ vs. $100 from Samsung. When I use smart TV it is very helpful to type with. Without it you will be very frustrated. The web browser I do not use at all. It is WAY TOO SLOW. I use Netflix, Pandora & BBC news thus far and you can not use regular HULU only Hulu plus which you pay for. It can network to your computer wireless to view photos and videos on your hard drive to view on the big screen. The bottom line is smart tv needs to get faster and easier to use. 99% of the time I hook up my laptop with an HDMI cable and use it as a big monitor. I have a wireless keyboard and mouse. I still can get Netflix, Pandora, regular Hulu and all other news broadcast via the internet. I do not have cable tv as I think it is a waste of money. So if I had to do it all over again I would of just got the same tv with 3D/HD instead of the browser for a few hundred less. Over all a nice tv. I am happy but it is the little things that no one tells you when your shopping.Update: June 2012.So far this TV looks and works great. One thing I notice is that the TV dims and brightens on its own. I usually have my laptop hooked up to it with a HDMI cord using it as a big monitor. So I will be on Google and the screen goes from bright to dim. I think it is the refresh rate? After investigating it online I see that is a gripe of people who own this. However, I have not had it happen to me while playing a movie through the laptop or through the web browser, on Netflix. Currently there is not a fix for this problem. I have been told to play with the auto-contrast turned on/off or the Auto-Brightness feature. So far I haven't figured it out.

Reviews.Title: Great  buy with a little flaw!
Reviews.Author: Ara2001
Reviews.Content: The picture and colors are great(I prefer Smasung/Sony's picture qulity to rest of brands). Applications make it more fun. web browser is not that impressive. I haven't got the remote and use android app remote with my cell phone. which is kinda nice tool. Will wait for keyboard remote to come out! I don't have cable tv.I use apps: netflix/BBC/Youtube/Vimeo/...Cons: backlight bleeding! I think it's the problem with LED(lcd) tvs. mine has two white-flashing spots at top corner and also a cloud in top middle.they show up only in an absolute dark scene.rest of time you won't see them.I am still not sure about returning since it might comeback with the same problem as i read on internet.Problem:Delivery is supposed to be "white glove" for 46"+ tv. mine was delivered to lesing office when I wasn't home. just more hassle since i called customer service before shoping and after shoping to confirm delivery method. it turned out ok.just something to think about.Ovrerall: It's a great Tv for the price.resolution colors,sound....and it's SMART!!!! I am hoping this smart/app thing for tv catch up soon (same as cellphones). Especially if HBOGO app starts working in future.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46D6300 46" 1080p 120 Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Outlander
Reviews.Content: We purchased our Samsung UN46D6300 46" LED HDTV from Amazon 1 month ago and have been quite pleased with it.  It was quite easy to set up and the picture and the sound quality are excellent.  A few things to be aware of:  first of all after having placed the order fortunately we were tracking it and watching for it as the carrier just left it at our door without ringing the bell or notifying us in any way when they left it. Fortunately we were at home at the time they left it.  The only potential problem  thusfar is that we are avid tennis fans and we were noticing that the ball at times did not appear to move smoothly across the court.  We called Samsung and the technician informed us that to correct this problem using the remote  select "Menu" then to go to the "Picture settings" and then to "Auto Motion" and select "Smooth" setting. They also informed us if this did not solve the problem to go back in and set the "Auto Motion" setting to "Clear".  After some experimentation we found the "Clear" setting to provide the best quality of picture.  Changing the setting did not seem to affect any other characteristics of other events.

Reviews.Title: So very happy with this TV.
Reviews.Author: J. Gobell
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing.  It's been a while since I had a TV, and I did not want to get one until I had a better sense of where the confusing field of products was going to end up.After lots of research (thankfully, not that I did :)) and looking at reviews, this TV rose to the top.  I am completely and totally satisfied.  The picture is great, the sound is great, and the integration of Netflix and Vudu and Pandora and other services is seamless.I also love that I can plug in a USB stick and watch movie files from the USB...and that just happens when you plug it in...no confusing interface.Buy this TV.

Reviews.Title: Promises a lot, delivers little
Reviews.Author: L. Gagnon
Reviews.Content: Just chiming in to say I also was hoping to watch my Netflix and Amazon subscriptions on my new Smart TV but NOOOOOO!The one time I tried Netflix it kept telling me to check my internet connection and no vod from Amazon either so I'm watching the freebies on the other apps right now and they work just fine. Pandora is the coolest thing ever.I guess it's time to cancel some memberships and subscribe to new ones.Bad on you Amazon you loose. It's easier to just cancel you than exchange the TV.BTW, Samsung TV web browser is the most worthless feature I ever saw. I bought this TV to stream sports from [...] which works perfectly on my PC but refuses to stream on the TV. The screen loads and just go white forever.What a bummer. Don't buy this TV specially for the web browser like I did.5 stars for PQ, 3 stars for internet and apps features hence the 4 stars rating.

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: Vindi
Reviews.Content: Someone else said best thing on the market for 2011. I totally agree! I have had this tv for over 6 months now and I love it. It has stunning graphics, great for gameplay, flawless bluray, very very sharp picture. If your debating between this one and the next level up, I would recommend saving the money and going with this. You won't miss the color contrast unless your in a completly blacked out room, and then unless you've watched the higher up model your entire life, you will still have a tough time noticing the differance.The shape and style works great for my living room as well. I love the digital out for optical on it. Makes it easy to just run all the sound through the tv and just have one line going through the surround sound, so if I change inputs nothing has to change on the receiver.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Brenda"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic picture and great TV. The only thing someone might want to know is that it is only WIFI ready. You need to purchase the WIFI USB attachment to connect to your wireless network. I was surprised by that.The Apps are wonderful. Instantly works with HULU Plus and Netflix. I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55D6300 LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: CarDi
Reviews.Content: Incredible picture.  So many clever features; still learning them all. TV speakers not bad, especially in TV's surround sound mode but have invested in external speakers.  Great video and audio options.  Going on two months, and all is great. Did a lot of research before choosing this.  It is the only Samsung 6000 series that has a built-in web browser.  It would have been nice if the Samsung Qwerty keyboard was included but I have since purchased it.  So far, the ohly drawback.

Reviews.Title: YOU CAN SKYPE WITH THIS TV!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael Hoffman "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Amazon says you cannot skype with this tv, YOU CAN!!! I downloaded the skype app, connected Samsungs webcam Samsung CY-STC1100 Smart TV Camera and it worked.This TV has an amazing picture and all around great tv.  I would get nothing but Samsung.

Reviews.Title: samsung 46-inch led lcd tv review
Reviews.Author: yfei
Reviews.Content: Overall speaking, this TV is excellent and is exactly what I want on picture quality. Initially I had some problems to get a clean and nice picture quality and finally I found the signal source from my satellite antenna is not a 1080P signal. I got a 1080P quality pictures by using a blue ray dvd disk. The satellite modem supports only 1080i signal NOT 1080P, and the frequency never reaches 120Hz on TV signals, always 60Hz or less. I am using a external home theater system for audio signal. So I can avaid the audio from the original TV speakers, which seems not quite high quality. The build-in internet access application is very difficult to use, hardly working for many people for an usual web browsing. You may need add some extra hardware to make your life easier for internet.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: nw
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Highly recommended.The Auto-motion plus feature is a bit annoying as others have noted, but can be easily turned off.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled
Reviews.Author: Twig "Twig"
Reviews.Content: If anyone says a 46" TV is too big for the bedroom ... they're wrong, LOL!(This coming from someone who 'til now has had a 20" "box" TV, and lies with my head 8" from the screen.)NOTE: The "main picture" above, with the four metal legs, is actually of another model. This one has the nice rectangular slab, which I'm glad about, as I can easily side my DVD player right in front.I don't know where to begin in my enthusiasm for this TV. The sound is GREAT; although I supposed if you were used to surround sound, you'd be underwhelmed, it's MORE than respectable, as far as I'm concerned: quite loud and rich, actually.As others have noted, picture is superb.I haven't had a chance to try the browser yet (waiting for the USB WiFi thing to arrive), but my new Roku is wonderful on it.I'm almost in tears at having such an awesome TV for the first time in my life.P.S. In the store the 40" version looked great, too; I almost went with that one. But my feeing is, IF you can afford it (and I financed 24 months no interest with the Amazon Store Card), it's worth the extra money, since you'll probably only buy a new TV every 3 years or so. I wanted a TV that would literally (not figuratively), make me jump with joy. And when I plugged this one in, I'm not embarrassed to say that's what I did!

Reviews.Title: Browser not good
Reviews.Author: srichakra123
Reviews.Content: I have this Tv for a week now. Overall I am satisfied with this TV but not satisfied with the browser. You get no sound when you play any video using the browser, if want to watch videos on cnn.com you get to see the picture but not hear it. So quite disappointed with the browser not supporting sound.The only reason why I went for this TV over UN40D6000 is for the browser , so if you do not need the browser go for UN40D6000 to save some $$$..

Reviews.Title: Great but No Amazon Prime Video
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Goulet
Reviews.Content: This is our bedroom tv.  Downstairs in the family room, we have a Panasonic which supports the Amazon Prime Video App.  Many Samsung LED's can also download this app.  For some reason, this particular model is NOT a compatible device for Amazon, which stinks because I watch a lot of videos from the Prime Video.Other than that, great tv!

Reviews.Title: A great HD TV
Reviews.Author: Novembergosh
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV that I bought for myself.After almost a month of review reading and visits to best buy to check out all the TV's on display, I picked this one. its been almost a year now that i made the big decision and bought the TV from Amazon. I must say I couldn't have asked for more. This TV is one of the best TV's I have seen and all my friends and visitors agree that it has stunning display. Be it HD channels or Sony playstation or Blu-Ray movies, everything is spectacular on this TV. Very happy with this purchase.Pros: elegant, spectacular displays, great featuresCons: Brightness and sharpness might need to be adjusted a little bit to get the best quality.

Reviews.Title: Get the UN46D6000 instead
Reviews.Author: JJ Finnigan
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN46D6300 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LED HDTV (Black)Stunning HDTV picture - We hosted a Super Bowl party, and everyone (even those who have expensive & relatively new HDTVs) commented that our picture is superior to theirs.  I LOVE this product as a TV set!But the internet features are super-disappointing.First off, internet features are not available unless you separately purchase a LAN Adapter that costs $55 to $75.Next, a manual on the internet suggests that you can use the included remote to bring an image of a keyboard onto the screen, which you can then use (via up-down & left-right arrows on the included remote) to imput letters (& also numbers).  But that is just not true.My experience: When I finally got onto the Hotmail site to check my email, I was commanded to enter my user name & password (both of which include letters) - Unfortunately, it is impossible to do so with the included remote, which does not have letter buttons.I phoned Samsung customer support twice, & was told "it could not be done on this model".So much for accessing my email.(I'm told there is a QWERTY keyboard coming out soon for $100, but the Keyboard & LAN adapter mean you've gotta pay over $150 to access your email account.)There are some pluses re internet & streaming video access.  If you're a hockey fan, you can get NHL games free.  I think it's Ditto for Major League Baseball games.  And if you want to pay for streaming video movies, you can get individual movies, such as "Moneyball" for $3.99, or you can sign up for monthly subscriptions from Hulu Plus or Netflix ($7.99/mo).As for me, I doubt I will ever use the internet feature, unless I switch my Netflix account from DVD to streaming video - But that is unlikely, since the top 8 (or more) movies on my DVD list currently are unavailable on streaming video.So compare: The big difference between the UN46D6300 (reviewed here) and the UN46D6000 is that the 6300 has limited internet capability.  But at today's Amazon prices (Feb 14, 2012), the 6300 is about 20% ($200) more expensive, and to use the internet capability, it also needs a minimum of $150 in additional hardware.If I had to do it over, I would buy the UN46D6000, and save $350.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Renee
Reviews.Content: I really like our new Samsung TV. I was pleasantly surprised when the delivery people brought the TV in and turned it on for us. And the picture is fantastic. This was our first new TV in a long time and well worth waiting for. We shopped around and we feel that we got a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Paul Freeman "Freedman"
Reviews.Content: Received the Smart Samsung TV 6300 series. Very pleased!  Picture is exceptional and we have enjoyed the streaming with Netflex as well as being able to get to BBC.  I did purchase the Querty remote for which I can't seem to find adequate instructions.  It does not look as if it will work with Netflex.  I have not hooked the TV to an HD source but am using the digital provided by Comcast. Hard for me to believe picture could be better.Samsung UN46D6300 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV with a couple of minor issues
Reviews.Author: John1213
Reviews.Content: For openers, the Samsung 46" Model 6300 is a terrific television.  The LED LCD technology presents a picture that is the equal of a plasma TV. Did a lot of comparing before buying and the Samsung is the best of the lot right now.  However, there are two issues; namely, the need to get both an adapter and a qwerty remote control above the cost of the TV.  Read carefully because it says "WiFi ready" and not "WiFi".  You have to purchase an adapter that is essentially an antenna to connect to the WiFi.  And an additional qwerty remote control to practically use the internet.  So the TV was not so "SMART" without addional expense.  Example: I also purcased a VIZIO this year that came with both WiFi and a qwerty remote.  For the price of the Samsung it should have also, in my opinion.  But still a great picture and the bells and whistles are fun. And I continue to be amazed at dealing with Amazon.  They are all about customer service and I am a big fan of their company.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: K E M
Reviews.Content: A bit apprehensive ordering online, but appreciated being able to track delivery.  Came on time in perfect condition, delivered fedex.  Did not realize what would be involved puttting it together, but were able to manage.  Being older and not familiar with current technology and terminology, so proved challenging.  However, breathed sigh of relief once completed and TV worked fine.  Love picture and the depth of details.  Sound volume could be higher, and not sure yet how to remedy and will pursue in time.  After looking at many others in stores and people's homes, I beleive this TV is superior to those - especially in picture quality and value for dollars spent.

Reviews.Title: BUY HTIS TV NOW!!!
Reviews.Author: Happy viewer
Reviews.Content: So i purchased this TV 2 days ago and i cant stop thinking about it.  It is absolutely the best looking TV i have ever watched.  I currently own a Sharp Aquos LCD and a Panasonic Viera Plasma and this TV blows them both away with ease.  The picture is just so full and rich and the colors so vibrant. Every show that i have watched on this vs my other is 10x better, even my wife was like "WOW! This tv looks good!".  The only thing i will sasy that was a drawback at first, I was playing Dead Island(new game with great graphics) on my PS3 and the screen was sketchy when you moved fast, so you have to turn off the Auto Motion Plus. It works wonders on regular tv or movie watching but doesnt like the video games much. But once i turned this off the game looked better than ever.  Gears of War 3 looks like an actual movie not a game on this tv, didnt do that on my other ones.  So buy this TV and you will never buy anything other than Samsung LED again!

Reviews.Title: A Really Smart TV, who is also fun to hang out with!
Reviews.Author: Alex "Researcher & Occasional Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing TV. I thought I had an HDTV for the last 4 years and was very happy with Samsung 40" 1080i LCD TV, but this TV made me realize what a real HDTV is. The picture quality and crispness blew me away - no settings, out of the box. Watching over the air broadcast HD is amazing, especially while watching sports - e.g., US Open finals.I have to admit I did little research, since I knew I wanted Samsung, and 46" only (not bigger). I didn't want a 3D either, but wanted the top of the line in 2D. This model was the best 2D in 46". It had web browser - the only difference above the 6000 model. So decided to go with it using Amazon prime and never disappointed!It's best for playing blu-ray movies and broadcast HD. The smart hub and apps are fine, but the user interface for navigating is clunky - too many clicks. Youtube app is especially bad, with a broken interface for typing and searching. They don't have amazon instant videos app too - surprising. Didn't matter too much for me, as I use streaming through the Sony blu-ray player, but something to improve for Samsung. I liked their Netflix app though.Using web browser is also a pain, but it's just a novelty and experiment at this stage. Sound is OK, not great, but I don't think anybody relies on TV speakers these days. I got a Sony HTCT550W 3D Sound Bar Home Theater System with Wireless Subwoofer and was quite happy with it (reviewed).

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: L. thompson
Reviews.Content: This is our first hdtv.  I've been waiting for "connected" tv's to progress to the level this one is at.  I have the set hardwired into our home gigabit network and can easily pull home movies and pictures off our pc that runs windows xp pro and Samsungs Allshare. It's just as easy to hop onto the internet with the browser and check email or what ever. A good portion of the included aps are worthwhile.  I have most sound output go through the home theater. No matter if I'm watching movies on directv, the dvd player or xbox games.  The browser does not port sound to the external speakers (or I don't have something hooked up correctly) so I have to switch to the tv's speakers if online.Very easy to do with the remote.  The picture is fantastic.  I have not noticed any problems with fast action.  We've watched a variety of auto races and are impressed with the picture.  Can't wait for the football season!

Reviews.Title: As Good As IT Gets
Reviews.Author: Old Timer
Reviews.Content: Our 40" Sony 40W4100 is an excellent TV.  Our son was looking for a new TV, so we gave him the Sony.  This gave us the opportunity to buy a 46" model.  We chose Samsung after reading oodles of reviews on TVs.  There are so many people out there who want to impress people with technical jargon and so many who complain about everything but the TV that a buyer has to sift through it all.  We bought this TV from ONE CALL, a truly superior store.  The TV was delivered by appointment and was in perfect shape.  This particular model TV  is a winner in all respects - worthy of a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Good quality TV
Reviews.Author: J. GRAMES
Reviews.Content: PROSHave had TV for more than one year and has performed reliably throughout.  I have two Samsung LED's; older 52" and this 46".  Swivel base is convenient for me and I consider a great option to have for a TV where wall mounting is nice, but unnecessary.  Lots of simple and easy connections, e.g. router internet cable, cable TV, blu-ray HDMI all work fine and audio out to older Amp super good.  Audio on TV very good too, just don't need it.  Over years Samsung apps have gotten better, but still sort of clumsy in my opinion.  A Roku or Apple TV will give somewhat better feel, just depends on type and degree of home integration you want to achieve.  This was a black friday purchase, I think 2 years ago?, and price point very good.  The 52" is running fine after >5 years.CONSDelivery was a problem.  I put a hold on delivery with UPS because I was out of town.  When returned found TV sitting in its native box with advertising on my front steps.  I gotta be kidding, right?  No.  I live in a safe neighborhood, but very unhappy sitting in elements for nearly two days.  So, I complained to UPS.  But, also I would hope Amazon would have boxed item shipped inside another box with additional padding.  Usual quality suffers during holidays, unfortunately.SUMMARY - If you like LED and good integration Samsung TV will give a good, solid performance and relatively high quality and features can be had in a model like this, because likely what you buy now will be newer and even more stream-lined.  Pay attention to delivery since it's a big, costly item.

Reviews.Title: Does not support Amazon Instant Video
Reviews.Author: MSans1
Reviews.Content: Liked the TV at first.  Our Christmas present to ourselves in 2011. This TV gets the most use in the house.Need Samsung proprietary WiFi adapter (I had one from a Samsung Blu-Ray player that worked)Browsing was difficult as others mentioned using the TV remote.  Free droid app helps.Wanted to use it for streaming amazon instant video but there is no app for it (I upgraded firmware to latest version on 25 Aug 13 and still not supported)  Also tried watching from the browser but it never gets past the 'loading' screen due to browser version incompatibility - and you can't upgrade it.Amazon Cloud player was recently added (in Aug 13) but haven't tried it yet.ISSUES: Video went out at 11th month - Samsung sent out a tech with parts - he replaced an internal board - did not fix.  A different tech came out again a couple of weeks later with more parts, still didn't fix.  Finally they replaced the LED panel which so far has fixed it.  The only thing original is the frame the TV came in - I'm sure it cost them more to try and fix than it would have to just replace the whole thing like we requested.  Because of our experience when we bought our next TV we went with LG - of course newer technology, but no issues with it.  The LG does everything we wanted this one to do.

Reviews.Title: The best purchase we could've made!
Reviews.Author: 6bucks
Reviews.Content: We love this TV.  The picture is crisp and clear.  Beautiful color!  We've had it for over a year and it works perfectly.  Was delivered quickly and set up is a breeze.

Reviews.Title: power cycling
Reviews.Author: Bart James
Reviews.Content: This model is power cycling repeated turning off and on when starting or in middle of program.. They had a class action suite in 2008 for using cheap capacitors to cut cost.  It looks like is back to same problem.  This showed up just as the warranty expired.  beware folks.  It looks like $200 -$300 bill to repair. beware folks.

Reviews.Title: Everything works fine....
Reviews.Author: Tray Sivell
Reviews.Content: just wished the bezel would have been the thinner version as shown in the sale photos. It's larger but not an issue.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: James M. Bailey
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV.  It has a great picture and is just the right size for my bedroom.  It has spoiled me since I could never go back to a regular TV.  The Internet features are not that great but I also have it connected to my computer so I do not use the Smart TV functions.  They are much too slow and a pain to use.  But again the TV itself is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality!!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: As a lot of other people said in here: This is an outstanding product for a great price! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Buy
Reviews.Author: Mamoon
Reviews.Content: Cant beat Samsung LED in picture quality. Excellent TV overall. Dont expect TV browser to work any close to what your laptop or desktop computer does. Its far far slower then any computer, too frustrating for me. Using the remote to type is also very frustrating and I think If you are trying to do things faster and you spend another 100 dollars on the qwerty remote you will still be frustrated as after typing fast you will still be waiting for a long time for the TV browser to respond. Much better to spend few dollars on hdmi cable and use your old laptop for that purpose. I think this is very much true for most TVs in the market. YOu will have to spend double or even more then that money to get computer fast browser on TV, I am sorry I dont have any examples for that to give. Thank you. Good luck with your TV search.

Reviews.Title: Broken in Less than a year with Complicated Servicing of Warranty
Reviews.Author: Marq
Reviews.Content: The display was beautiful though as other reviewers have noted, the "smart" functions are less than stellar to use.  It does pull up online videos, which was part of the function I needed.  It is light and has great sound.However at the 11 month mark the TV powered off and would not turn on.  The light next to the power button flashed in sets of two and I live-chatted with Samsung online support.  After freezing out of 4 chats, plugging and unplugging, I was told that since I live in a large city in Mexico (incidentally the country where the TV was made) the warranty will not cover parts and in-home service because I bought the TV on Amazon.com (US) and it was shipped here.  Even though there are contracted/certified Samsung techs less than 5 minutes from my house the warranty will not cover.  Therefore I went to Sears (where they have certified tech support) paid the fee for an in-home diagnosis and the tech tells me that the part will cost me $600.00 USD.  I have limited options.  If I mail the TV to the US for service, it will cost me several hundred dollars for shipping and insurance.  Basically either way, I'm out half the cost of the television.I found on line that this is a common problem with these televisions and that after resisting Samsung decided to pay service and parts admitting the glitch.  However that doesn't help me in the slightest.I expect a product such as this to function longer than a year and that a company such as Samsung to work with customers to solve the problem for products under warranty.My ticket was referred to a contractor in the US who asked me to ship the TV to him.  Had I bought the TV in Mexico, Samsung would have paid the total for their faulty TV to be fixed, but I crossed the border and now I'm out more than half the price of the TV.Same company, same faulty product with same glitch, no recourse.  I order a lot through Amazon US (at least 1-2 times per week), but will have to rethink ordering big ticket items until I move back to the U.S.

Reviews.Title: Awsome TV
Reviews.Author: A-regular-guy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice tv. I upgraded from a Samsung Plasma to this one. It has a great picutre the color display is almost as nice as the plasma, and that is hard to beat! It is super thin and has alot of nice internet features, I have had it for around 6 months now and am happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality TV - Would Definitely Buy Again
Reviews.Author: MD-OK
Reviews.Content: Excellent Picture Quality!!  This TV arrived as promised and was easy to set up.  The "SmartTV" functions enabled us to be up and running in no time.  The biggest pro for this TV has to be the bright, clear, crisp picture.  This TV was purchased for our bedroom where previously we watched very little TV.  We have a larger Mitsubishi HDTV in the living room that usually took up most of our TV viewing time.  However, the picture on this Samsung is amazingly better so we are now watching many of our shows  on this TV instead.  Would definitely recommend to anyone as an excellent product to buy!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46"
Reviews.Author: JohnGalt6789
Reviews.Content: TV is fantastic. I will definitely buy from Amazon Warehouse again. Fantastic bargains and items are as adverstised in as-new condition. Only issue, which is minor, is the TV's sound speakers are pretty weak. But I'm guessing most people get a sound system with these units.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: J. Mathew "Mathew"
Reviews.Content: I have been researching TVs for past 4 - 5 months and this is one great product. Stunning HDTV picture. Perhaps the wireless Adaptor should be included for a nominal price along with the TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV..
Reviews.Author: Vijgan
Reviews.Content: Really nice TV. It has pre-installed apps such as Netflix, Hulu-Plus etc. However had some trouble setting up Netflix though. But overall, nice specs and worth the money u spend...

Reviews.Title: This TV is awesome
Reviews.Author: J. D. Riche "Dost"
Reviews.Content: Start off saying that I don't care about 3D.  I was pretty impressed with the Samsung Smart TV..it's easy to use, but they could find a better way to enter text.  Somebody was saying there's a way, but I haven't found it yet.  The downloadable app for my android is good.  It works fine.  It's nice when I can't find the remote or it's being used by somebody else.  The picture is drop dead perfection.  I'm not a videophile, but I looked in Best Buy, Fry's, etc before I ordered here (yes i use them as showrooms, which is all they deserve with their service) and there's just no comparison.  The LG and Sony come in 2nd, but not a close second.  Isn't it mostly about picture quality??  So far I've hooked this up to a Roku and plugged it directly in with a ethernet cable to the airport extreme.  I've got a 30 Mbps connection and everthing loads up in 1080 quality FAST.  I have heard terrible things about the linkstick and why bother using WIFI...it's just going to be slower.  If there's a reason to use the WIFI, I haven't discovered it yet.  I can always purchase the linkstick later, if need be.  This thing is razor thin, gorgeous and I have zero complaints.  Anything can be improved, even the iPhone, so to me, this is as close to perfection as it gets.  VERY happy.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: kman8674
Reviews.Content: this is a great tv the picture is perfect and the sound is real good. the 120 mhz is a waste tho the pic looks fake but you have the option of turning it off, use the 120 only for sports.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46D6300
Reviews.Author: Richard Espinet
Reviews.Content: Firstly,excellent price and service from Amazon. The TV quality is excellent;I love it. Didn't realise that I needed the wirelss LAN adaptor to utilise the wireless features. Perhaps that should be included or offered at the time. If anything, the volume could be a bit low depending on the show and the wireless faetures could be a bit slow and cumbersome but I need to play around with it a bit more.Overall agreat TV with super quality and some smart features. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Straightforward configuration, superb picture and sound quality.
Reviews.Author: Eric Almeida
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television largely for sports viewing, and was intent on easy installation and setup. I found the user interface well-designed, and performed the entire configuration within 30 minutes.Most importantly, the picture and sound quality are superb. I'm pleased to have bought this unit in advance of the NFL playoffs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Victor Revenko
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about LED TV's and ratings for this one before I purchased it.It appeared to be the best SMART LEDTV with WIFI capbility( no 3D by my choice) for the price.  I ordered from Amazon and it arrived in perfect shape. I bought a Samsung compatable WIFI for the internet and I was all set.  The TV has performed excellently and the internet and SMART hookups work well. I have no hesitation in giving  SAMSUNG( our second TV from them) and this TV excellent marks. I would not hesitate to buy it again.

Reviews.Title: This TV to almost TO GOOD
Reviews.Author: Scott Lusebrink
Reviews.Content: The words "this tv is too good" have been uttered many times at my house when people first see this TV.  The picture is amazing.  As soon as I plugged it in we sat down and watched the first channel that was on just staring and the depth and how brilliant the picture was.  And I don't even like Monk that much.The "to good" part I think if from the 120Hz and what people are calling the Soap Opera Effect.  I highly recommend googling this and see if you like the picture better with any of the recommended solutions.  I haven't gotten to try many but putting the TV in Game mode may be a good answer.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Gorgeous Image!
Reviews.Author: Jorden Nye
Reviews.Content: I did a few weeks of intensive on-line research before deciding to buy this TV. Over the past 35 years, I have only purchased Sony TVs, so I was definitely pre-disposed to buy another Sony. My old SONY 36" beheamoth just didn't seem like it was ever going to die, so I was just simply going to have to send it off to TV heaven and finally convert to a flat screen TV. I checked out all the reviews here on Amazon for various TVs and did a lot of looking over several months whenever I was in a store with TVs.
